definition: to undertake/to carry/to shoulder/to take responsibility
picul (100 catties, 50 kg)/two buckets full/carrying pole and its load/classifier for loads carried on a shoulder pole
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)

sentences.english: Shoulder angle working face big mechanized mining captain Zhao-Bing told reporters.
sentences.chinese: 担负大倾角工作面开采的综采队队长孙兆冰告诉笔者。

sentences.english: The Mossad has a record of taking startling risks.
sentences.chinese: 摩萨德曾有担负令人震惊的风险作案的先例。

sentences.english: A disunited nation has to incur unduly high costs of government.
sentences.chinese: 一个分裂的国家必须担负过度高昂的政府费用。

sentences.english: The rod-shaped filaments of the microtubules are responsible for dividing the chromosomes in a cell.
sentences.chinese: 微管杆形丝担负划分细胞中染色体的角色。

sentences.english: The father bird also protects the nest and keeps enemies away.
sentences.chinese: 鸟爸爸还担负护巢和保持敌人远离的任务。

sentences.english: Teachers haudio-videoe to fill the parental role and not be aloof and cold.
sentences.chinese: 西宾们必须担负父母的角色，而不应冷淡与不友好。

sentences.english: Shaq takes some of the press off me and allows me to chill.
sentences.chinese: 沙克担负了我身上的一些重担，我可以少出点汗。

sentences.english: The mortar ammo bearers should provide security to the gun team.

sentences.english: He shoulders the responsibility of high political office.
sentences.chinese: 他在担负着高级官职的责任。

sentences.english: Colleges and universities, being the forward positions, take on an important mission of combating the peaceful evolution from socialism back to capitalisn.
sentences.chinese: 高校是反和平演变斗争的前沿阵地，担负着重要使命。

sentences.english: That is the responsibility we bear.
College has the same task on pushing the media talents transformation.

definition: to shoulder (a burden)/to bear/to suffer (a disadvantage)
to be duty bound/to be one's unshirkable responsibility
to be in charge of/to take responsibility for/to be to blame/conscientious
to share (a burden, a cost, a responsibility)
to implement/to carry out/to execute/to run
